meanings.sent1: The squabby cat struggled to climb the tall tree.
meanings.sent2: The baby elephant looked squabby next to its mother.
meanings.sent3: The squabby penguin waddled comically across the ice.
meanings.sent4: The squabby clouds hung low in the sky, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The squabby toddler's chubby cheeks were irresistible to pinch.

meanings.definition: Resembling a squab in size or shape
meanings.sent1: The squabby chair was perfect for the small corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The squabby pillow looked out of place on the large sofa.
meanings.sent3: The squabby toy duck was a cute addition to the collection.
meanings.sent4: The squabby building nestled among the taller skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The squabby fruit resembled a miniature version of its larger counterpart.

meanings.sent1: The squabby teddy bear was comforting to hug at night.
meanings.sent2: The squabby marshmallow melted in the hot chocolate.
meanings.sent3: The squabby seal basked lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The squabby caterpillar inched along the leaf with ease.
meanings.sent5: The squabby clouds looked like fluffy cotton candy in the sky.
